StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [MCRISS_OWNER]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@ProcName sysname = NULL, @Owner sysname = NULL, @NewOwner sysname = NULL, @PrintFlag char(1) = NULL AS
--- default new owner to dbo SET @NewOwner = COALESCE(@NewOwner, 'dbo')
--- default print .ag to N SET @PrintFlag = COALESCE(@PrintFlag, 'N')
DECLARE @SQLString varchar(2500) DECLARE @WarningMessage varchar(250)
--- IF NO PROCEDURE NAME IS PASSED IN, LOOP THROUGH AND CHANGE THE OWNER OF ALL --- STORED PROCEDURES AND USER-DEFINED FUNCTIONS THAT MEET THE SEARCH CRITERIA IF @ProcName IS NULL BEGIN DECLARE sproc_Cursor CURSOR FOR SELECT O.NAME, U.NAME FROM SYSOBJECTS O INNER JOIN SYSUSERS U ON (O.UID = U.UID AND O.XTYPE IN ('P', 'FN') AND U.NAME = COALESCE(@Owner, U.NAME) AND U.NAME NOT IN ('dbo', @NewOwner))
OPEN sproc_Cursor
FETCH NEXT FROM sproc_Cursor INTO @ProcName, @Owner
WHILE @@FETCH_STATUS = 0 BEGIN --- CHANGE THE OBJECT OWNER SET @SQLString = 'EXEC sp_ChangeObjectOwner @objname = ''' + @Owner + '.' + @ProcName + ''', @newowner = ''' + @NewOwner + ''''
IF @PrintFlag = 'Y' PRINT @SQLString ELSE EXEC (@SQLString)
FETCH NEXT FROM sproc_Cursor INTO @ProcName, @Owner END
CLOSE sproc_Cursor DEALLOCATE sproc_Cursor END ELSE BEGIN --- CHANGE THE OBJECT OWNER SET @SQLString = 'EXEC sp_ChangeObjectOwner @objname = ''' + @Owner + '.' + @ProcName + ''', @newowner = ''' + @NewOwner + ''''
IF @PrintFlag = 'Y' PRINT @SQLString ELSE EXEC (@SQLString) END
--- DISPLAY THE PERMISSIONS WARNING MESSAGE SET @WarningMessage = CASE @PrintFlag WHEN 'Y' THEN 'IF YOU CHANGE THE OWNER OF ANY STORED PROCEDURES AND/OR USER-DEFINED FUNCTIONS, PLEASE REMEMBER TO REGRANT PERMISSIONS IF NECESSARY.' ELSE 'PLEASE REMEMBER TO REGRANT PERMISSIONS IF NECESSARY AFTER CHANGING THE OWNER OF STORED PROCEDURES AND/OR USER-DEFINED FUNCTIONS.' END PRINT CHAR(13) PRINT @WarningMessage
